oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Carmina. Liber 4. English & Latin
Verba ambigua Horati : the enigma of Book IV
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Horace
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: text_and_corpus_linguistics
Academic dissertations
Latin poetry
Translations
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This text seeks to explore Book IV of Horace's Odes not as isolated works of adulatory verse, but as a collection of subliminal vignettes on Roman society in the early days of the Principate. That they were written as individual items over a period of time, ranging from 13 BC. to 8 BC., is not disputed. That they were really intended by Horace as a complete entity in their own right is the primary argument of this work and is supported by a full translation, commentary and analysis of the Latin text in which the order of the odes has been reconstituted
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Oxford Text Archive, University of Oxford
